The Wikipedia wordmark which displays the name Wikipedia, written in all caps. The W and the A are the same height and both are taller than the other letters, which are also all the same height.

Wikipedia, the sixth-most-used website, is facing an internal crisis
according to the ratings firm comScore.

had lost nearly ten percent of its page views last year. There was a decline of about two billion between December 2012 and December 2013. Its most popular versions are leading the slide: page-views of the English Wikipedia declined by twelve percent, those of German version slid by 17 percent and the Japanese version lost nine percent.
While Wikipedia's managers think that this could be due to errors in counting, other experts feel that Google's <a href=
>Knowledge Graphs project launched last year may be gobbling up Wikipedia users.
Berkman Klein Center for Internet & Society
If you can get your question answered from the search page, you don't need to click [any further].
White-haired elderly gentleman in suit and tie speaks at a podium.
a flawed and irresponsible research tool
as not to make Wikipedia rightist but for it to include our point of view
